item.title: Artificial Intelligence Is Rushing Into Patient Care - And Could Raise Risks
item.description: AI developers cull electronic health records because they hold huge amounts of detailed data, Cho said. But those developers often arent aware that theyre building atop a deeply broken system. Electronic health records were developed for billing, not patient care, and are filled with mistakes or missing data.A KHN investigation published in March found sometimes life-threatening errors in patients medication lists, lab tests and allergies. Read on scientificamerican.com
